Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL
Name: Beads and necklaces
Description: Strings of white, blue and red glazed faience beads, and a string of pottery beads from which the glaze has perhaps been lost. Most are simple disc beads, but the group includes open flower beads with suspension-cord hole bored through the centre. The beads were retrieved by the English archaeologist Flinders Petrie from an urban context, a quarter of the city of Memphis: they may date to different periods.
